question: I have dark brown eyes that are turning gray from the outer rim toward the pupil. The process has been taking years.  At the beginning I though it was the iris changing color, but now it is clear that the gray shadow is allocated between the iris and the cornea.No pain and no vision problems (other than my natural astigmatism)  I am 38 and never use contact lenses.I am not overweight.  My grandmother suffered senile diabetes and cataracts at 80Should I be worry?
title: Dark brown eyes turning gray
